form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of South Carolina (for himself, Mr. Budd, Mr. Barrasso, Mrs. Hyde-Smith, Mr. Risch, Mr. Daines, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mr. Cramer, and Mr. Crapo) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship

form.official-title: To prohibit the Administrator of the Small Business Administration from directly making loans under the 7(a) loan program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Access to Credit for Small Businesses Act.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any provision of subsection (a) of section 7 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)), the Administrator of the Small Business Administration may not directly make a loan pursuant to such subsection.

The Administrator of the Small Business Administration shall service a direct loan made under section 7(a) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 636(a)) if such loan was made before the date of enactment of this Act.
